Q0.reasoning: Patient is undergoing BRCA1/2 testing per clinical information; the provided policy (AHS–M2003) specifically addresses BRCA1/2 testing and related multi-gene panels.

Q1.reasoning: Policy requires individuals be ≥18 and lists meeting criteria for breast-cancer cases diagnosed before 51 years (II.2.a.i). Patient is 46 and thus meets the age-based criteria.

Q2.reasoning: The policy requires precertification and genetic counseling but does not define specific ordering-provider specialty requirements; the note that testing must follow counseling is present but no ordering-provider restrictions are specified.

Q3.reasoning: Medical-necessity coverage criteria include individuals with personal history of breast cancer diagnosed before age 51 and/or with ≥1 close blood relative with pancreatic cancer (II.2.a.i and II.2.a.i(g)(iv)). The patient has a personal history of breast cancer at age 46 and a close relative with pancreatic cancer, meeting coverage criteria.

Q4.reasoning: The policy does not mandate completion of specific prior tests before BRCA1/2 testing; it notes prior limited testing may affect approach but does not require particular prior tests. Patient's prior nondiagnostic CMA is not specified as a required prior test.

Q5.reasoning: Policy coverage criteria explicitly consider family history (close blood relative with pancreatic cancer qualifies — Note 1 and II.2.a.i(g)(iv)). The patient has a mother with pancreatic cancer and multiple affected maternal relatives.

Q6.reasoning: Policy requires individuals have received genetic counseling prior to testing (II.1 and multiple sections). Patient completed pre-test genetic counseling and plans post-test follow-up, satisfying counseling requirement.

Q7.reasoning: The provided policy document does not list or map specific CPT codes for BRCA1/2 testing; therefore a specific CPT from the given options cannot be determined from policy text.

Q8.reasoning: Based on policy AHS–M2003 (II.2.a.i), the patient (age 46 with personal history of breast cancer diagnosed <51 and a close relative with pancreatic cancer) meets coverage criteria for BRCA testing; genetic counseling was completed, so testing is covered.
